place.name: MUNSLEY
place.gazetteerText: MUNSLEY, a parish, with a village, in Ledbury district, Hereford; 1 mile N E of Ashperton r. station, and 3¾ N W of Ledbury. Post-town, Ledbury. Acres, 1, 228. Real property, £1, 908. Pop., 234. Houses, 36. The property is divided among a few. The havingis a rectory in the diocese of Hereford. Value, £227. Patron, the Rev. J. Hopton. The church is old, and was recently in disrepair. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
